Location: <img alt="Colombia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Flag_of_Colombia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Colombia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Cauca, Colombia
Details: One soldier was killed and another wounded in an ELN guerrilla attack on a military patrol in a rural area of the department of Cauca, southern Colombia, the army said in a statement on Friday.[72]

Location: <img alt="Syria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Flag_of_Syria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Syria.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Aleppo, Syria
Details: 2017 Aleppo suicide car bombing:A strong explosion occurred in a district of Aleppo. According to provisional data, a motor bomb had exploded. The blast killed more than 126 people.[73]

Location: <img alt="Iraq" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Flag_of_Iraq.svg/23px-Flag_of_Iraq.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="411" data-file-height="274"> Abu Sayda, Iraq
Details: A bomb kills one and another were injured.[74]

Location: <img alt="India" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/23px-Flag_of_India.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1350" data-file-height="900"> Pulwama, India
Details: A worker of a local party was killed and another injured after unidentified suspected militants stormed the former’s home in Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday night and opened fire.[75]

Location: <img alt="Philippines" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="450"> Philippines
Details: A man, who was kidnapped by Abu Sayyaf, was executed by his captors.[76]

Location: <img alt="Turkey" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Flag_of_Turkey.svg/23px-Flag_of_Turkey.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Muradiye Turkey
Details: PKK insurgents kills one village guard in Turkey.[77]

Location: <img alt="Turkey" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Flag_of_Turkey.svg/23px-Flag_of_Turkey.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Muradiye, Turkey
Details: Motorcade of AK Party district chairman Ibrahim Vanli attacked by PKK militants in Muradiye district of Van; Vanli's nephew Adnan, who was also a guard were killed.[78]

Location: <img alt="Mali" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Mali.svg/23px-Flag_of_Mali.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Gourma-Rharous, Mali
Details: Four malian soldiers were killed when terrorists attacked their base. Sixteen other soldiers were also injured.[79]

Location: <img alt="Mali" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Mali.svg/23px-Flag_of_Mali.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Tessalit, Mali
Details: Two soldiers and one civilian were injured during an attack against their UN covoy.[79]

Location: <img alt="Iraq" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Flag_of_Iraq.svg/23px-Flag_of_Iraq.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="411" data-file-height="274"> Mosul, Iraq
Details: A suicide car bombing killed at least 16 civilians in Mosul's al-Thawra district. The bomber attempted to target military units nearby, but having failed to breach security, detonated the vehicle in a nearby alley instead.[80]

Location: <img alt="Egypt" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Flag_of_Egypt.svg/23px-Flag_of_Egypt.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> South Sinai Governorate, Egypt
Details: A suicide bomber detonated at a checkpoint near a church in Southern Sinai, killing an officer and wounding four others.[81]

Location: <img alt="United States" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1235" data-file-height="650"> Fresno, United States
Details: A shooting spree occurred in Fresno, California, leaving three men dead. The prime suspect, identified as Kori Ali Muhammad, was then arrested by police and charged with murder and assault with a deadly weapon. Muhammad, who was believed to have been motivated by racial hatred directed towards white people, was already wanted in connection with the murder of a security guard at a local Motel 6 that had occurred five days earlier.[82][83]

Location: <img alt="Greece" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Greece.svg/23px-Flag_of_Greece.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"> Athens, Greece
Details: A small explosive device detonated outside a building housing Eurobank offices in central Athens, damaging its entrance and shattering windows, police said. No wounded were reported[84]

Location: <img alt="France" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/23px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Paris, France
Details: 2017 shooting of Paris police officers: One police officer was killed, two other and a women injured in a shooting in the Champs-Élysées area of Paris. One of the two gunmen was killed in the attack. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[85]

Location: <img alt="Afghanistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"> Balkh Province, Afghanistan
Details: 2017 Camp Shaheen attack: Attack of military base by Taliban insurgents in northern Afghanistan killed 250 Afghan soldiers. More than 160 were also injured.[86]

Location: <img alt="Russia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/f/f3/Flag_of_Russia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Russia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Khabarovsk, Russia
Details: Two people were killed in an attack in a Federal Security Service office in the Russian city of Khabarovsk. The gunman was also killed. The Russian Federal Security Service says the native 18-year-old perpetrator was a known member of a neo-nazi group.[87]

Location: <img alt="Turkey" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Flag_of_Turkey.svg/23px-Flag_of_Turkey.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Sirnak, Turkey
Details: Three soldiers were martyred in a PKK attack in southeastern Sirnak province on Friday, according to officials. The office said earlier that at least three other militants were killed on Friday in Bestler-Dereler.[88]

Location: <img alt="Israel" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/21px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png" width="21" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="660" data-file-height="480"> Tel Aviv, Israel
Details: Four people were lightly injured after being stabbed by an 18-year-old Palestinian at two different beach hotels on Tel Aviv's waterfront. Police at the scene confirmed that the attack was terror-related.[89]

Location: <img alt="Somalia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Flag_of_Somalia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Somalia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Galgala, Somalia
Details: A roadside bomb in a remote town in Somalia's semi-autonomous state of Puntland killed 8 soldiers and injured 3 others. The attack was blamed by regional military officials on Islamic State-affiliated militants.[90]

Location: <img alt="Iraq" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Flag_of_Iraq.svg/23px-Flag_of_Iraq.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="411" data-file-height="274"> Ar-Rutbah, Iraq
Details: Islamic State militants ambushed a convoy carrying soldiers, border guards and local police officers just outside of Ar-Rutbah, killing 10 and injuring 20 others.[91]

Location: Kalandia, West Bank
Details: A female soldier was lightly wounded at the Kalandia checkpoint on the outskirts of Jerusalem.[92]

Location: <img alt="India" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/23px-Flag_of_India.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1350" data-file-height="900"> Sukma, India
Details: 2017 Sukma attack: Suspected Maoist rebels ambushed a group of Central Reserve Police Force officers who were guarding road workers in the Sukma district of Chhattisgarh. At least 25 CRPF soldiers were killed and 7 others were critically injured in the attack, which was one of the deadliest in recent years. Maoists killed 11 soldiers in a similar ambush in the same district at the beginning of March.[93][94]

Location: <img alt="Afghanistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"> Khost, Afghanistan
Details: A suicide attack happened outside a US base in eastern Afghanistan that has hosted CIA operatives who are hunting al Qaeda and other jihadists in the region. Four Afghan Special Force members were killed and six others were injured. Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[95]

Location: <img alt="Nigeria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Flag_of_Nigeria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Nigeria.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="400"> Maiduguri, Nigeria
Details: Two bombings blew up in the Nigerian city Maiduguri. Seven persons were killed.[96]

Location: <img alt="Pakistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Flag_of_Pakistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Pakistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Parachinar, Pakistan
Details: A van hit a landmine killing 14 passengers included children, and injuring 9 others, among them two census workers. Both Jamaat-ul-Ahrar and Islamic State claimed responsibility.[97][98]

Location: <img alt="Turkey" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Flag_of_Turkey.svg/23px-Flag_of_Turkey.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Southern Turkey
Details: In the Uludere district of Şırnak province nearby the village of Andaç, which was detonated when security forces scanning the area were passing by. According to information obtained from security sources, two Turkish soldiers died and two more heavily wounded soldiers were transferred to the Şırnak State Hospital by helicopter.A trap that had been set in a patch in the Çemçe-Madur region caused the death of two soldiers and wounded one other. Another soldier was killed, and two others were injured during field scan activities near Sehi forest in eastern Bitlis province.[99]

Location: <img alt="Nigeria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Flag_of_Nigeria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Nigeria.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="400"> Borno, Nigeria
Details: Four civilians were killed and 13 others were injured when three suicide bombers blew themself up.[100]

Location: <img alt="Nigeria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Flag_of_Nigeria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Nigeria.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="400"> Maiduguri, Nigeria
Details: A vigilante and a civilian were killed and 11 others were injured when three suicide bombers blew themself up.[96]

Location: <img alt="Iran" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Flag_of_Iran.svg/23px-Flag_of_Iran.svg.png" width="23" height="13" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="630" data-file-height="360"> Mirjaveh County, Iran
Details: Nine Iranian border guards were killed and two others were injured while patrolling at the Iran-Pakistan border. Jaish ul-Adl claimed responsibility for the attack.[101]

Location: <img alt="Egypt" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Flag_of_Egypt.svg/23px-Flag_of_Egypt.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Rafah, Egypt
Details: An Islamic State suicide bomber killed four members of a Bedouin tribe and wounded others in Rafah.[102]

Location: <img alt="Colombia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Flag_of_Colombia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Colombia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Norte de Santander Department, Colombia
Details: ELN guerrillas detonated a bomb in a pipeline of limon pipe in the municipality of El Carmen, Norte de Santander.[103][104]

Location: <img alt="Paraguay" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Flag_of_Paraguay.svg/23px-Flag_of_Paraguay.svg.png" width="23" height="13" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="330"> Concepción Paraguay
Details: Militants of Paraguayan People's Army they shot a security guard in the department of Concepción.[105][106]

Location: <img alt="Nigeria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Flag_of_Nigeria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Nigeria.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="400"> Kano, Nigeria
Details: At least five soldiers were killed and another 40 injured when a Boko Haram extremist blew himself up.[107]

Location: <img alt="Iraq" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Flag_of_Iraq.svg/23px-Flag_of_Iraq.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="411" data-file-height="274"> Baghdad, Iraq
Details: A suicide car bomb attack on a traffic police compound in central Baghdad Friday killed at least four people and wounded six.[108]

Location: <img alt="Philippines" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="450"> Davao City, Philippines
Details: A suspected member of the New People's Army was killed while two others were injured in separate attacks here on Saturday. Communist rebels attacked the Lapanday Foods Corp, torching equipment and disarming security guards. The attack killed a fish vendor.[109][110]
